div.div: Find important documents and information here! Student Handbook, Health Exams and Requirements, School Supply List, Dress Code and more...
Reading, writing and exercise are important for a healthy lifestyle. Exercise your brain with our District 99 online resources.

input.name: q

input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

div.div: Find important documents and information here! Student Handbook, Health Exams and Requirements, School Supply List, Dress Code and more...
Reading, writing and exercise are important for a healthy lifestyle. Exercise your brain with our District 99 online resources.

div.p: This is Cicero District 99's official information center on the preventative measures that will be implemented to ensure the safety and wellness of our staff and our students as it relates to the Coronavirus (COVID-19).
The District is implementing precautionary measures as outlined by:
Illinois Department of Health and the Illinois State Board of Education.
TO TAKE A QUICK SURVEY SO THE DISTRICT CAN BETTER MEET YOUR NEEDS
We know that each student and family may be undergoing a variety of challenges and Cicero District 99 wants to support the entire community.
Please take some time to read, download, and print our weekly Remote Learning Newsletters
The safety and well-being of students, staff and families remain the top priority for District 99. At this time, Cicero District 99 has decided that:
All District 99 Schools will be CLOSED FOR IN-PERSON INSTRUCTION

p.span: FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 2019-2020 SCHOOL YEAR

div.p: This decision comes with a heavy heart as we know this will impact all of our faculty, staff, administrators, students and families in some way.

While our schools will remain closed for in-person instruction, academic opportunities and experiences through remote learning will continue to provide students with a variety of ways to engage with the school community.

p.strong: Please know that everyone at D99 understands the importance of identifying ways to honor and recognize students through celebrations, graduations, and student achievement ceremonies. We are working diligently to identify alternative structures that both provide for the health and safety of our school community while also ensuring our students' efforts are recognized and celebrated.

div.p: All state-standardized testing has been SUSPENDED
School days will NOT be made up

hr.p: *More information on specific events will be updated continuously right here and on social media.

div.p: District 99 administrators are continuing to monitor this situation and will provide updates to the District community as they become AVAILABLE and CONFIRMED

hr.p: 3/24/20 The District was alerted that there were two confirmed cases of COVID-19 — one affiliated with Warren Park Elementary School, and one affiliated with Abraham Lincoln Elementary School. The last presumed contact in the school buildings occurred no later than March 13.

3/15/20 District administrators were informed that a parent of two students who attended both Cicero East at Woodbine and Unity Junior High School was in contact with an individual that tested positive for COVID-19. There were no reports of the parent or students exhibiting any symptoms.

p.span: *We are not at liberty to share additional information due to the confidential nature of individuals' health records. We ask that you reach out to your health care provider on general guidance on how to proceed, if you have specific concerns related to potential contact and/or symptoms

p.em: If you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 AND develop a fever and symptoms, such as cough or difficulty breathing, call your healthcare provider for medical advice.

header.h2: From The Desk Of The Superintendent

div.p: Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez urges the community to please help us keep everyone safe by staying home, and making sure to follow the COVID-19 prevention guidelines and most importantly to
Stay safe and bell well!

span.cite: *Three Days Worth Of Meals Will Be Provided

div.p: Mar. 25, 2020- Univision Chicago- Regalan almuerzos escolares a estudiantes en Cicero en medio de la crisis por el coronavirus
Mar. 20, 2020- mySuburbanLife- 'People need to be taken care of.' Berwyn, Cicero school districts provide thousands of meals to students.

In partnership with Cicero Town President Larry Dominick and the Town of Cicero's board of trustees, Cicero District 99 has provided a list of alternate locations to get information about housing, healthcare, mental health, food stability, and SNAP/Medical application support.

header.h2: D99 At The Forefront Of Remote Learning

div.p: Apr. 17, 2020- Univision Chicago- ¿Qué retos van a enfrentar los estudiantes del Distrito 99 ante el cierre de escuelas en Illinois?
Apr. 6, 2020- The Jen Weigel Show WLS-AM 890- Keeping Up on Covid-19: Superintendent Rudy Hernandez discusses keeping students safe in their Google classrooms

Cicero District 99 would like to remind the community on the importance of having children connect to their classes and complete their assignments. The district is making sure students continue to receive quality instruction and this can not be possible if they do not connect with their teachers.
At this time, if a student has questions regarding their assignments or activities, they should reach out directly to their teachers through Schoology or Google Classroom. Teachers will be available:
Parents are encouraged to make sure their children are continuing to use the reading and math tools available online.
In addition to completing the activities assigned by teachers each day, District 99 recommends that students spend at least:
ONE HOUR doing math and ONE HOUR reading

a.span: CLICK HERE TO LOG-IN TO SCHOOLOGY
CLICK HERE TO ACCESS GOOGLE CLASSROOM

span.a: CLICK HERE TO LOG-IN TO IMAGINE MATH
CLICK HERE TO LOG-IN TO SPLASH MATH
CLICK HERE TO LOG-IN TO IXL
CLICK HERE TO LOG-IN TO IMAGINE LEARNING
CLICK HERE TO LOG-IN TO ACHEIVE 3000

span.span: CLICK HERE TO VISIT OUR STUDENTS PAGE FOR MORE RESOURCES

div.noscript: You must have JavaScript enabled in your web browser to use the media player.

div.p: In light of the growing global concerns surrounding the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), Cicero District 99 administrators and health care providers have been carefully monitoring new and developments on the illness as provided by:

p.strong: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is the No.1 source of information for COVID-19
Check out their guide to help you make decisions and seek appropriate medical care by visiting the
Illinois Department of Public Health Coronavirus Hotline:

p.b: To make an appointment please call

div.p: Administration Building
